9.2 Technical Definitions and Lemmas

Definition 14 (Technical Definition)

Let c1â€²:=pâ¢(s1â€²,â€¦,snâ€²)â†ğâ€²assignsubscriptsuperscriptğ‘â€²1ğ‘subscriptsuperscriptğ‘ â€²1â€¦subscriptsuperscriptğ‘ â€²ğ‘›â†superscriptğâ€²c^{\prime}_{1}:=p(s^{\prime}_{1},\dots,s^{\prime}_{n})\leftarrow\textup{\bf B}^{\prime}italic_c start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT := italic_p ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , â€¦ , italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) â† B start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT be a clause such that

  • â€¢

    Vâ¢aâ¢râ¢(c1â€²)âˆ©Vâ¢aâ¢râ¢(Q,Qâ€²)=âˆ…ğ‘‰ğ‘ğ‘Ÿsubscriptsuperscriptğ‘â€²1ğ‘‰ğ‘ğ‘Ÿğ‘„superscriptğ‘„â€²Var(c^{\prime}_{1})\cap Var(Q,Q^{\prime})=\varnothingitalic_V italic_a italic_r ( italic_c start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) âˆ© italic_V italic_a italic_r ( italic_Q , italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) = âˆ… and

  • â€¢

    c1=c1â€²â¢Î³subscriptğ‘1subscriptsuperscriptğ‘â€²1ğ›¾c_{1}=c^{\prime}_{1}\gammaitalic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_c start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î³ for some renaming Î³ğ›¾\gammaitalic_Î³ satisfying Vâ¢aâ¢râ¢(Î³)âŠ†Vâ¢aâ¢râ¢(c1,c1â€²)ğ‘‰ğ‘ğ‘Ÿğ›¾ğ‘‰ğ‘ğ‘Ÿsubscriptğ‘1subscriptsuperscriptğ‘â€²1Var(\gamma)\subseteq Var(c_{1},c^{\prime}_{1})italic_V italic_a italic_r ( italic_Î³ ) âŠ† italic_V italic_a italic_r ( italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_c start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ).

As c1â€²subscriptsuperscriptğ‘â€²1c^{\prime}_{1}italic_c start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is a variant of c1subscriptğ‘1c_{1}italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and c1subscriptğ‘1c_{1}italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is a variant of cğ‘citalic_c, then c1â€²subscriptsuperscriptğ‘â€²1c^{\prime}_{1}italic_c start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is a variant of cğ‘citalic_c. Moreover, as Ï„+superscriptğœ\tau^{+}italic_Ï„ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is DN for cğ‘citalic_c, by PropositionÂ 3, Ï„+superscriptğœ\tau^{+}italic_Ï„ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is DN for c1â€²subscriptsuperscriptğ‘â€²1c^{\prime}_{1}italic_c start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. So, by (DN2) in DefinitionÂ 13, for each âŸ¨iâ†¦uiâŸ©âˆˆÏ„+â¢(p)delimited-âŸ¨âŸ©maps-toğ‘–subscriptğ‘¢ğ‘–superscriptğœğ‘\langle i\mapsto u_{i}\rangle\in\tau^{+}(p)âŸ¨ italic_i â†¦ italic_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âŸ© âˆˆ italic_Ï„ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_p ) there exists a substitution Î´isubscriptğ›¿ğ‘–\delta_{i}italic_Î´ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT such that ui=siâ€²â¢Î´isubscriptğ‘¢ğ‘–subscriptsuperscriptğ‘ â€²ğ‘–subscriptğ›¿ğ‘–u_{i}=s^{\prime}_{i}\delta_{i}italic_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î´ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.

Moreover, as pâ¢(t1â€²,â€¦,tnâ€²)ğ‘subscriptsuperscriptğ‘¡â€²1â€¦subscriptsuperscriptğ‘¡â€²ğ‘›p(t^{\prime}_{1},\dots,t^{\prime}_{n})italic_p ( italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , â€¦ , italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) is Î”â¢[Ï„+]Î”delimited-[]superscriptğœ\Delta[\tau^{+}]roman_Î” [ italic_Ï„ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ]-more general than pâ¢(t1,â€¦,tn)ğ‘subscriptğ‘¡1â€¦subscriptğ‘¡ğ‘›p(t_{1},\dots,t_{n})italic_p ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , â€¦ , italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ), for each âŸ¨iâ†¦uiâŸ©âˆˆÏ„+â¢(p)delimited-âŸ¨âŸ©maps-toğ‘–subscriptğ‘¢ğ‘–superscriptğœğ‘\langle i\mapsto u_{i}\rangle\in\tau^{+}(p)âŸ¨ italic_i â†¦ italic_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âŸ© âˆˆ italic_Ï„ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_p ), tiâ€²subscriptsuperscriptğ‘¡â€²ğ‘–t^{\prime}_{i}italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is an instance of uisubscriptğ‘¢ğ‘–u_{i}italic_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. So, there exists a substitution Î´iâ€²subscriptsuperscriptğ›¿â€²ğ‘–\delta^{\prime}_{i}italic_Î´ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT such that tiâ€²=uiâ¢Î´iâ€²subscriptsuperscriptğ‘¡â€²ğ‘–subscriptğ‘¢ğ‘–subscriptsuperscriptğ›¿â€²ğ‘–t^{\prime}_{i}=u_{i}\delta^{\prime}_{i}italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î´ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.

For each iâˆˆDâ¢oâ¢mâ¢(Ï„+â¢(p))ğ‘–ğ·ğ‘œğ‘šsuperscriptğœğ‘i\in Dom(\tau^{+}(p))italic_i âˆˆ italic_D italic_o italic_m ( italic_Ï„ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_p ) ), we set

Ïƒi=dâ¢eâ¢f(Î´iâ¢Î´iâ€²)|Vâ¢aâ¢râ¢(siâ€²).superscriptğ‘‘ğ‘’ğ‘“subscriptğœğ‘–conditionalsubscriptğ›¿ğ‘–subscriptsuperscriptğ›¿â€²ğ‘–ğ‘‰ğ‘ğ‘Ÿsubscriptsuperscriptğ‘ â€²ğ‘–\sigma_{i}\stackrel{{\scriptstyle def}}{{=}}(\delta_{i}\delta^{\prime}_{i})|Var(s^{\prime}_{i})\;.italic_Ïƒ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_RELOP SUPERSCRIPTOP start_ARG = end_ARG start_ARG italic_d italic_e italic_f end_ARG end_RELOP ( italic_Î´ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î´ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | italic_V italic_a italic_r ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) .

Moreover, we set:

Ïƒ=dâ¢eâ¢fâ‹ƒiâˆˆDâ¢oâ¢mâ¢(Ï„+â¢(p))Ïƒi.superscriptğ‘‘ğ‘’ğ‘“ğœsubscriptğ‘–ğ·ğ‘œğ‘šsuperscriptğœğ‘subscriptğœğ‘–\sigma\stackrel{{\scriptstyle def}}{{=}}\bigcup\limits_{i\in Dom(\tau^{+}(p))}\sigma_{i}\;.italic_Ïƒ start_RELOP SUPERSCRIPTOP start_ARG = end_ARG start_ARG italic_d italic_e italic_f end_ARG end_RELOP â‹ƒ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i âˆˆ italic_D italic_o italic_m ( italic_Ï„ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_p ) ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ïƒ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .
Lemma 1

The set Ïƒğœ\sigmaitalic_Ïƒ of DefinitionÂ 14 is a well-defined substitution.

Proof

Notice that, as Ï„+superscriptğœ\tau^{+}italic_Ï„ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is DN for c1â€²subscriptsuperscriptğ‘â€²1c^{\prime}_{1}italic_c start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, by (DN1) in DefinitionÂ 13 we have

âˆ€iâˆˆDâ¢oâ¢mâ¢(Ï„+â¢(p)),âˆ€jâˆˆ[1,n]âˆ–{i},Vâ¢aâ¢râ¢(siâ€²)âˆ©Vâ¢aâ¢râ¢(sjâ€²)=âˆ….formulae-sequencefor-allğ‘–ğ·ğ‘œğ‘šsuperscriptğœğ‘formulae-sequencefor-allğ‘—1ğ‘›ğ‘–ğ‘‰ğ‘ğ‘Ÿsubscriptsuperscriptğ‘ â€²ğ‘–ğ‘‰ğ‘ğ‘Ÿsubscriptsuperscriptğ‘ â€²ğ‘—\forall i\in Dom(\tau^{+}(p)),\;\forall j\in[1,n]\setminus\{i\},\;Var(s^{\prime}_{i})\cap Var(s^{\prime}_{j})=\varnothing\;.âˆ€ italic_i âˆˆ italic_D italic_o italic_m ( italic_Ï„ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_p ) ) , âˆ€ italic_j âˆˆ [ 1 , italic_n ] âˆ– { italic_i } , italic_V italic_a italic_r ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) âˆ© italic_V italic_a italic_r ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = âˆ… .

Consequently,

âˆ€i,jâˆˆDâ¢oâ¢mâ¢(Ï„+â¢(p)),iâ‰ jâ‡’Dâ¢oâ¢mâ¢(Ïƒi)âˆ©Dâ¢oâ¢mâ¢(Ïƒj)=âˆ….formulae-sequencefor-allğ‘–ğ‘—ğ·ğ‘œğ‘šsuperscriptğœğ‘ğ‘–ğ‘—â‡’ğ·ğ‘œğ‘šsubscriptğœğ‘–ğ·ğ‘œğ‘šsubscriptğœğ‘—\forall i,j\in Dom(\tau^{+}(p)),\;i\neq j\Rightarrow Dom(\sigma_{i})\cap Dom(\sigma_{j})=\varnothing\;.âˆ€ italic_i , italic_j âˆˆ italic_D italic_o italic_m ( italic_Ï„ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_p ) ) , italic_i â‰  italic_j â‡’ italic_D italic_o italic_m ( italic_Ïƒ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) âˆ© italic_D italic_o italic_m ( italic_Ïƒ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = âˆ… .

Moreover, for each iâˆˆDâ¢oâ¢mâ¢(Ï„+â¢(p))ğ‘–ğ·ğ‘œğ‘šsuperscriptğœğ‘i\in Dom(\tau^{+}(p))italic_i âˆˆ italic_D italic_o italic_m ( italic_Ï„ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_p ) ), Ïƒisubscriptğœğ‘–\sigma_{i}italic_Ïƒ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is a well-defined substitution. So, Ïƒğœ\sigmaitalic_Ïƒ is a well-defined substitution. âˆ

Lemma 2 (Technical Lemma)

Let c1â€²:=pâ¢(s1â€²,â€¦,snâ€²)â†ğâ€²assignsubscriptsuperscriptğ‘normal-â€²1ğ‘subscriptsuperscriptğ‘ normal-â€²1normal-â€¦subscriptsuperscriptğ‘ normal-â€²ğ‘›normal-â†superscriptğnormal-â€²c^{\prime}_{1}:=p(s^{\prime}_{1},\dots,s^{\prime}_{n})\leftarrow\textup{\bf B}^{\prime}italic_c start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT := italic_p ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , â€¦ , italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) â† B start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT be a clause such that

  • â€¢

    Vâ¢aâ¢râ¢(c1â€²)âˆ©Vâ¢aâ¢râ¢(Q,Qâ€²)=âˆ…ğ‘‰ğ‘ğ‘Ÿsubscriptsuperscriptğ‘â€²1ğ‘‰ğ‘ğ‘Ÿğ‘„superscriptğ‘„â€²Var(c^{\prime}_{1})\cap Var(Q,Q^{\prime})=\varnothingitalic_V italic_a italic_r ( italic_c start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) âˆ© italic_V italic_a italic_r ( italic_Q , italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) = âˆ… and

  • â€¢

    c1=c1â€²â¢Î³subscriptğ‘1subscriptsuperscriptğ‘â€²1ğ›¾c_{1}=c^{\prime}_{1}\gammaitalic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_c start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î³ for some renaming Î³ğ›¾\gammaitalic_Î³ satisfying Vâ¢aâ¢râ¢(Î³)âŠ†Vâ¢aâ¢râ¢(c1,c1â€²)ğ‘‰ğ‘ğ‘Ÿğ›¾ğ‘‰ğ‘ğ‘Ÿsubscriptğ‘1subscriptsuperscriptğ‘â€²1Var(\gamma)\subseteq Var(c_{1},c^{\prime}_{1})italic_V italic_a italic_r ( italic_Î³ ) âŠ† italic_V italic_a italic_r ( italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_c start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ).

Let Ïƒğœ\sigmaitalic_Ïƒ be the substitution of DefinitionÂ 14. Then, the substitution Ïƒâ¢Î·â¢Î³â¢Î¸ğœğœ‚ğ›¾ğœƒ\sigma\eta\gamma\thetaitalic_Ïƒ italic_Î· italic_Î³ italic_Î¸ is a unifier of pâ¢(t1â€²,â€¦,tnâ€²)ğ‘subscriptsuperscriptğ‘¡normal-â€²1normal-â€¦subscriptsuperscriptğ‘¡normal-â€²ğ‘›p(t^{\prime}_{1},\dots,t^{\prime}_{n})italic_p ( italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , â€¦ , italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) and pâ¢(s1â€²,â€¦,snâ€²)ğ‘subscriptsuperscriptğ‘ normal-â€²1normal-â€¦subscriptsuperscriptğ‘ normal-â€²ğ‘›p(s^{\prime}_{1},\dots,s^{\prime}_{n})italic_p ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , â€¦ , italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ).

Proof

The result follows from the following facts.

  • â€¢

    For each âŸ¨iâ†¦uiâŸ©âˆˆÏ„+â¢(p)delimited-âŸ¨âŸ©maps-toğ‘–subscriptğ‘¢ğ‘–superscriptğœğ‘\langle i\mapsto u_{i}\rangle\in\tau^{+}(p)âŸ¨ italic_i â†¦ italic_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âŸ© âˆˆ italic_Ï„ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_p ), we have:

    siâ€²â¢Ïƒ=siâ€²â¢Ïƒi=siâ€²â¢Î´iâ¢Î´iâ€²=(siâ€²â¢Î´i)â¢Î´iâ€²=uiâ¢Î´iâ€²=tiâ€²subscriptsuperscriptğ‘ â€²ğ‘–ğœsubscriptsuperscriptğ‘ â€²ğ‘–subscriptğœğ‘–subscriptsuperscriptğ‘ â€²ğ‘–subscriptğ›¿ğ‘–subscriptsuperscriptğ›¿â€²ğ‘–subscriptsuperscriptğ‘ â€²ğ‘–subscriptğ›¿ğ‘–subscriptsuperscriptğ›¿â€²ğ‘–subscriptğ‘¢ğ‘–subscriptsuperscriptğ›¿â€²ğ‘–subscriptsuperscriptğ‘¡â€²ğ‘–s^{\prime}_{i}\sigma=s^{\prime}_{i}\sigma_{i}=s^{\prime}_{i}\delta_{i}\delta^{\prime}_{i}=(s^{\prime}_{i}\delta_{i})\delta^{\prime}_{i}=u_{i}\delta^{\prime}_{i}=t^{\prime}_{i}italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ïƒ = italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ïƒ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î´ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î´ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î´ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_Î´ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î´ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT

    and tiâ€²â¢Ïƒ=tiâ€²subscriptsuperscriptğ‘¡â€²ğ‘–ğœsubscriptsuperscriptğ‘¡â€²ğ‘–t^{\prime}_{i}\sigma=t^{\prime}_{i}italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ïƒ = italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT because Dâ¢oâ¢mâ¢(Ïƒ)âŠ†Vâ¢aâ¢râ¢(c1â€²)ğ·ğ‘œğ‘šğœğ‘‰ğ‘ğ‘Ÿsubscriptsuperscriptğ‘â€²1Dom(\sigma)\subseteq Var(c^{\prime}_{1})italic_D italic_o italic_m ( italic_Ïƒ ) âŠ† italic_V italic_a italic_r ( italic_c start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) and Vâ¢aâ¢râ¢(Qâ€²)âˆ©Vâ¢aâ¢râ¢(c1â€²)=âˆ…ğ‘‰ğ‘ğ‘Ÿsuperscriptğ‘„â€²ğ‘‰ğ‘ğ‘Ÿsubscriptsuperscriptğ‘â€²1Var(Q^{\prime})\cap Var(c^{\prime}_{1})=\varnothingitalic_V italic_a italic_r ( italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) âˆ© italic_V italic_a italic_r ( italic_c start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = âˆ…. So, siâ€²â¢Ïƒ=tiâ€²â¢Ïƒsubscriptsuperscriptğ‘ â€²ğ‘–ğœsubscriptsuperscriptğ‘¡â€²ğ‘–ğœs^{\prime}_{i}\sigma=t^{\prime}_{i}\sigmaitalic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ïƒ = italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ïƒ and siâ€²â¢Ïƒâ¢Î·â¢Î³â¢Î¸=tiâ€²â¢Ïƒâ¢Î·â¢Î³â¢Î¸subscriptsuperscriptğ‘ â€²ğ‘–ğœğœ‚ğ›¾ğœƒsubscriptsuperscriptğ‘¡â€²ğ‘–ğœğœ‚ğ›¾ğœƒs^{\prime}_{i}\sigma\eta\gamma\theta=t^{\prime}_{i}\sigma\eta\gamma\thetaitalic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ïƒ italic_Î· italic_Î³ italic_Î¸ = italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ïƒ italic_Î· italic_Î³ italic_Î¸.

  • â€¢

    For each iâˆˆ[1,n]âˆ–Dâ¢oâ¢mâ¢(Ï„+â¢(p))ğ‘–1ğ‘›ğ·ğ‘œğ‘šsuperscriptğœğ‘i\in[1,n]\setminus Dom(\tau^{+}(p))italic_i âˆˆ [ 1 , italic_n ] âˆ– italic_D italic_o italic_m ( italic_Ï„ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_p ) ), we have:

    siâ€²â¢Î·â¢Î³â¢Î¸=(siâ€²â¢Î·)â¢Î³â¢Î¸=siâ€²â¢Î³â¢Î¸=(siâ€²â¢Î³)â¢Î¸=siâ¢Î¸subscriptsuperscriptğ‘ â€²ğ‘–ğœ‚ğ›¾ğœƒsubscriptsuperscriptğ‘ â€²ğ‘–ğœ‚ğ›¾ğœƒsubscriptsuperscriptğ‘ â€²ğ‘–ğ›¾ğœƒsubscriptsuperscriptğ‘ â€²ğ‘–ğ›¾ğœƒsubscriptğ‘ ğ‘–ğœƒs^{\prime}_{i}\eta\gamma\theta=(s^{\prime}_{i}\eta)\gamma\theta=s^{\prime}_{i}\gamma\theta=(s^{\prime}_{i}\gamma)\theta=s_{i}\thetaitalic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î· italic_Î³ italic_Î¸ = ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î· ) italic_Î³ italic_Î¸ = italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î³ italic_Î¸ = ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î³ ) italic_Î¸ = italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î¸

    and

    tiâ€²â¢Î·â¢Î³â¢Î¸=(tiâ€²â¢Î·)â¢Î³â¢Î¸=tiâ¢Î³â¢Î¸=(tiâ¢Î³)â¢Î¸=tiâ¢Î¸subscriptsuperscriptğ‘¡â€²ğ‘–ğœ‚ğ›¾ğœƒsubscriptsuperscriptğ‘¡â€²ğ‘–ğœ‚ğ›¾ğœƒsubscriptğ‘¡ğ‘–ğ›¾ğœƒsubscriptğ‘¡ğ‘–ğ›¾ğœƒsubscriptğ‘¡ğ‘–ğœƒt^{\prime}_{i}\eta\gamma\theta=(t^{\prime}_{i}\eta)\gamma\theta=t_{i}\gamma\theta=(t_{i}\gamma)\theta=t_{i}\thetaitalic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î· italic_Î³ italic_Î¸ = ( italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î· ) italic_Î³ italic_Î¸ = italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î³ italic_Î¸ = ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î³ ) italic_Î¸ = italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î¸

    and siâ¢Î¸=tiâ¢Î¸subscriptğ‘ ğ‘–ğœƒsubscriptğ‘¡ğ‘–ğœƒs_{i}\theta=t_{i}\thetaitalic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î¸ = italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î¸ because Î¸ğœƒ\thetaitalic_Î¸ is a unifier of pâ¢(s1,â€¦,sn)ğ‘subscriptğ‘ 1â€¦subscriptğ‘ ğ‘›p(s_{1},\dots,s_{n})italic_p ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , â€¦ , italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) and pâ¢(t1,â€¦,tn)ğ‘subscriptğ‘¡1â€¦subscriptğ‘¡ğ‘›p(t_{1},\dots,t_{n})italic_p ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , â€¦ , italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) (because Qâ¢âŸ¹cÎ¸Q1ğ‘„subscriptsuperscriptâŸ¹ğœƒğ‘subscriptğ‘„1Q\mathop{\Longrightarrow}\limits^{\theta}_{c}Q_{1}italic_Q âŸ¹ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT with c1subscriptğ‘1c_{1}italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT as input clause used). So,

    siâ€²â¢Î·â¢Î³â¢Î¸=tiâ€²â¢Î·â¢Î³â¢Î¸subscriptsuperscriptğ‘ â€²ğ‘–ğœ‚ğ›¾ğœƒsubscriptsuperscriptğ‘¡â€²ğ‘–ğœ‚ğ›¾ğœƒs^{\prime}_{i}\eta\gamma\theta=t^{\prime}_{i}\eta\gamma\thetaitalic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î· italic_Î³ italic_Î¸ = italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î· italic_Î³ italic_Î¸ (4)
  • â€¢

    For each iâˆˆ[1,n]âˆ–Dâ¢oâ¢mâ¢(Ï„+â¢(p))ğ‘–1ğ‘›ğ·ğ‘œğ‘šsuperscriptğœğ‘i\in[1,n]\setminus Dom(\tau^{+}(p))italic_i âˆˆ [ 1 , italic_n ] âˆ– italic_D italic_o italic_m ( italic_Ï„ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_p ) ), we also have:

    • â€“

      siâ€²â¢Ïƒ=siâ€²subscriptsuperscriptğ‘ â€²ğ‘–ğœsubscriptsuperscriptğ‘ â€²ğ‘–s^{\prime}_{i}\sigma=s^{\prime}_{i}italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ïƒ = italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT because Dâ¢oâ¢mâ¢(Ïƒ)=Vâ¢aâ¢râ¢({sjâ€²|jâˆˆDâ¢oâ¢mâ¢(Ï„+â¢(p))})ğ·ğ‘œğ‘šğœğ‘‰ğ‘ğ‘Ÿconditional-setsubscriptsuperscriptğ‘ â€²ğ‘—ğ‘—ğ·ğ‘œğ‘šsuperscriptğœğ‘Dom(\sigma)=Var\big{(}\{s^{\prime}_{j}\;|\;j\in Dom(\tau^{+}(p))\}\big{)}italic_D italic_o italic_m ( italic_Ïƒ ) = italic_V italic_a italic_r ( { italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_j âˆˆ italic_D italic_o italic_m ( italic_Ï„ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_p ) ) } ) and, by (DN1) in DefinitionÂ 13, Vâ¢aâ¢râ¢({sjâ€²|jâˆˆDâ¢oâ¢mâ¢(Ï„+â¢(p))})âˆ©Vâ¢aâ¢râ¢(siâ€²)=âˆ…ğ‘‰ğ‘ğ‘Ÿconditional-setsubscriptsuperscriptğ‘ â€²ğ‘—ğ‘—ğ·ğ‘œğ‘šsuperscriptğœğ‘ğ‘‰ğ‘ğ‘Ÿsubscriptsuperscriptğ‘ â€²ğ‘–Var\big{(}\{s^{\prime}_{j}\;|\;j\in Dom(\tau^{+}(p))\}\big{)}\cap Var(s^{\prime}_{i})=\varnothingitalic_V italic_a italic_r ( { italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_j âˆˆ italic_D italic_o italic_m ( italic_Ï„ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_p ) ) } ) âˆ© italic_V italic_a italic_r ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = âˆ…;

    • â€“

      tiâ€²â¢Ïƒ=tiâ€²subscriptsuperscriptğ‘¡â€²ğ‘–ğœsubscriptsuperscriptğ‘¡â€²ğ‘–t^{\prime}_{i}\sigma=t^{\prime}_{i}italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ïƒ = italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT because Dâ¢oâ¢mâ¢(Ïƒ)âŠ†Vâ¢aâ¢râ¢(c1â€²)ğ·ğ‘œğ‘šğœğ‘‰ğ‘ğ‘Ÿsubscriptsuperscriptğ‘â€²1Dom(\sigma)\subseteq Var(c^{\prime}_{1})italic_D italic_o italic_m ( italic_Ïƒ ) âŠ† italic_V italic_a italic_r ( italic_c start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) and Vâ¢aâ¢râ¢(Qâ€²)âˆ©Vâ¢aâ¢râ¢(c1â€²)=âˆ…ğ‘‰ğ‘ğ‘Ÿsuperscriptğ‘„â€²ğ‘‰ğ‘ğ‘Ÿsubscriptsuperscriptğ‘â€²1Var(Q^{\prime})\cap Var(c^{\prime}_{1})=\varnothingitalic_V italic_a italic_r ( italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) âˆ© italic_V italic_a italic_r ( italic_c start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = âˆ….

    Therefore, because ofÂ (4), siâ€²â¢Ïƒâ¢Î·â¢Î³â¢Î¸=tiâ€²â¢Ïƒâ¢Î·â¢Î³â¢Î¸subscriptsuperscriptğ‘ â€²ğ‘–ğœğœ‚ğ›¾ğœƒsubscriptsuperscriptğ‘¡â€²ğ‘–ğœğœ‚ğ›¾ğœƒs^{\prime}_{i}\sigma\eta\gamma\theta=t^{\prime}_{i}\sigma\eta\gamma\thetaitalic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ïƒ italic_Î· italic_Î³ italic_Î¸ = italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ïƒ italic_Î· italic_Î³ italic_Î¸. âˆ

9.3 Î”Î”\Deltaroman_Î”-Propagation

Now we extend the following Propagation Lemma that is proved by Apt in [1] p.Â 54â€“56.

Lemma 3 (Propagation)

Let GğºGitalic_G, G1subscriptğº1G_{1}italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, Gâ€²superscriptğºnormal-â€²G^{\prime}italic_G start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and G1â€²subscriptsuperscriptğºnormal-â€²1G^{\prime}_{1}italic_G start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT be queries such that Gâ¢âŸ¹cG1ğºsubscriptnormal-âŸ¹ğ‘subscriptğº1G\mathop{\Longrightarrow}\limits_{c}G_{1}italic_G âŸ¹ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and Gâ€²â¢âŸ¹cG1â€²superscriptğºnormal-â€²subscriptnormal-âŸ¹ğ‘subscriptsuperscriptğºnormal-â€²1G^{\prime}\mathop{\Longrightarrow}\limits_{c}G^{\prime}_{1}italic_G start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŸ¹ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and:

  • â€¢

    GğºGitalic_G is an instance of Gâ€²superscriptğºâ€²G^{\prime}italic_G start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT

  • â€¢

    in GğºGitalic_G and Gâ€²superscriptğºâ€²G^{\prime}italic_G start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT atoms in the same positions are selected.

Then, G1subscriptğº1G_{1}italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is an instance of G1â€²subscriptsuperscriptğºnormal-â€²1G^{\prime}_{1}italic_G start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.

First we establish the following result.

Lemma 4

Suppose that there exists an SLD-derivation step of form Qâ€²â¢âŸ¹cÎ¸â€²Q1â€²superscriptğ‘„normal-â€²subscriptsuperscriptnormal-âŸ¹superscriptğœƒnormal-â€²ğ‘subscriptsuperscriptğ‘„normal-â€²1Q^{\prime}\mathop{\Longrightarrow}\limits^{\theta^{\prime}}_{c}Q^{\prime}_{1}italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŸ¹ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT where pâ¢(t1â€²,â€¦,tnâ€²)ğ‘subscriptsuperscriptğ‘¡normal-â€²1normal-â€¦subscriptsuperscriptğ‘¡normal-â€²ğ‘›p(t^{\prime}_{1},\dots,t^{\prime}_{n})italic_p ( italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , â€¦ , italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) is the selected atom and the input clause is c1â€²subscriptsuperscriptğ‘normal-â€²1c^{\prime}_{1}italic_c start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT such that Vâ¢aâ¢râ¢(Q)âˆ©Vâ¢aâ¢râ¢(c1â€²)=âˆ…ğ‘‰ğ‘ğ‘Ÿğ‘„ğ‘‰ğ‘ğ‘Ÿsubscriptsuperscriptğ‘normal-â€²1Var(Q)\cap Var(c^{\prime}_{1})=\varnothingitalic_V italic_a italic_r ( italic_Q ) âˆ© italic_V italic_a italic_r ( italic_c start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = âˆ…. Then, Q1â€²subscriptsuperscriptğ‘„normal-â€²1Q^{\prime}_{1}italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is Î”â¢[Ï„+]normal-Î”delimited-[]superscriptğœ\Delta[\tau^{+}]roman_Î” [ italic_Ï„ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ]-more general than Q1subscriptğ‘„1Q_{1}italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.

Proof

Notice that we have

Vâ¢aâ¢râ¢(Q)âˆ©Vâ¢aâ¢râ¢(c1)=Vâ¢aâ¢râ¢(Q,Qâ€²)âˆ©Vâ¢aâ¢râ¢(c1â€²)=âˆ….ğ‘‰ğ‘ğ‘Ÿğ‘„ğ‘‰ğ‘ğ‘Ÿsubscriptğ‘1ğ‘‰ğ‘ğ‘Ÿğ‘„superscriptğ‘„â€²ğ‘‰ğ‘ğ‘Ÿsubscriptsuperscriptğ‘â€²1Var(Q)\cap Var(c_{1})=Var(Q,Q^{\prime})\cap Var(c^{\prime}_{1})=\varnothing\;.italic_V italic_a italic_r ( italic_Q ) âˆ© italic_V italic_a italic_r ( italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = italic_V italic_a italic_r ( italic_Q , italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) âˆ© italic_V italic_a italic_r ( italic_c start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = âˆ… .

Moreover, as c1subscriptğ‘1c_{1}italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is a variant of c1â€²subscriptsuperscriptğ‘â€²1c^{\prime}_{1}italic_c start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, there exists a renaming Î³ğ›¾\gammaitalic_Î³ such that

Vâ¢aâ¢râ¢(Î³)âŠ†Vâ¢aâ¢râ¢(c1,c1â€²)â¢Â andÂ â¢c1=c1â€²â¢Î³.ğ‘‰ğ‘ğ‘Ÿğ›¾ğ‘‰ğ‘ğ‘Ÿsubscriptğ‘1subscriptsuperscriptğ‘â€²1Â andÂ subscriptğ‘1subscriptsuperscriptğ‘â€²1ğ›¾Var(\gamma)\subseteq Var(c_{1},c^{\prime}_{1})\text{\quad and \quad}c_{1}=c^{\prime}_{1}\gamma\;.italic_V italic_a italic_r ( italic_Î³ ) âŠ† italic_V italic_a italic_r ( italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_c start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) and italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_c start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î³ .

Let c1â€²:=pâ¢(s1â€²,â€¦,snâ€²)â†ğâ€²assignsubscriptsuperscriptğ‘â€²1ğ‘subscriptsuperscriptğ‘ â€²1â€¦subscriptsuperscriptğ‘ â€²ğ‘›â†superscriptğâ€²c^{\prime}_{1}:=p(s^{\prime}_{1},\dots,s^{\prime}_{n})\leftarrow\textup{\bf B}^{\prime}italic_c start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT := italic_p ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , â€¦ , italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) â† B start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. Then,

Q1=(ğ€,ğ,ğ‚)â¢Î¸â¢Â andÂ â¢Q1â€²=(ğ€â€²,ğâ€²,ğ‚â€²)â¢Î¸â€².subscriptğ‘„1ğ€ğğ‚ğœƒÂ andÂ subscriptsuperscriptğ‘„â€²1superscriptğ€â€²superscriptğâ€²superscriptğ‚â€²superscriptğœƒâ€²Q_{1}=(\textup{\bf A},\textup{\bf B},\textup{\bf C})\theta\text{\quad and \quad}Q^{\prime}_{1}=(\textup{\bf A}^{\prime},\textup{\bf B}^{\prime},\textup{\bf C}^{\prime})\theta^{\prime}\;.italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ( A , B , C ) italic_Î¸ and italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ( A start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , B start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , C start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT .

Ï„+superscriptğœ\tau^{+}italic_Ï„ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is DN for cğ‘citalic_c and c1â€²subscriptsuperscriptğ‘â€²1c^{\prime}_{1}italic_c start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is a variant of cğ‘citalic_c. So, by PropositionÂ 3, Ï„+superscriptğœ\tau^{+}italic_Ï„ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is DN for c1â€²subscriptsuperscriptğ‘â€²1c^{\prime}_{1}italic_c start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Let Ïƒğœ\sigmaitalic_Ïƒ be the substitution of DefinitionÂ 14.

  • â€¢

    Let Aâ€²:=qâ¢(v1â€²,â€¦,vmâ€²)âˆˆğ€â€²assignsuperscriptğ´â€²ğ‘subscriptsuperscriptğ‘£â€²1â€¦subscriptsuperscriptğ‘£â€²ğ‘šsuperscriptğ€â€²A^{\prime}:=q(v^{\prime}_{1},\dots,v^{\prime}_{m})\in\textup{\bf A}^{\prime}italic_A start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT := italic_q ( italic_v start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , â€¦ , italic_v start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) âˆˆ A start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. As ğ€â€²superscriptğ€â€²\textup{\bf A}^{\prime}A start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is Î”â¢[Ï„+]Î”delimited-[]superscriptğœ\Delta[\tau^{+}]roman_Î” [ italic_Ï„ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ]-more general than A for Î·ğœ‚\etaitalic_Î·, ğ€â€²superscriptğ€â€²\textup{\bf A}^{\prime}A start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and A have the same length. Moreover, if kğ‘˜kitalic_k denotes the position of Aâ€²superscriptğ´â€²A^{\prime}italic_A start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT in ğ€â€²superscriptğ€â€²\textup{\bf A}^{\prime}A start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, then the kthsuperscriptğ‘˜thk^{\text{th}}italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT th end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT atom of A has form qâ¢(v1,â€¦,vm)ğ‘subscriptğ‘£1â€¦subscriptğ‘£ğ‘šq(v_{1},\dots,v_{m})italic_q ( italic_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , â€¦ , italic_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ).

    • â€“

      As Aâ€²superscriptğ´â€²A^{\prime}italic_A start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is Î”â¢[Ï„+]Î”delimited-[]superscriptğœ\Delta[\tau^{+}]roman_Î” [ italic_Ï„ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ]-more general than Ağ´Aitalic_A for Î·ğœ‚\etaitalic_Î·, for each âŸ¨jâ†¦ujâŸ©âˆˆÏ„+â¢(q)delimited-âŸ¨âŸ©maps-toğ‘—subscriptğ‘¢ğ‘—superscriptğœğ‘\langle j\mapsto u_{j}\rangle\in\tau^{+}(q)âŸ¨ italic_j â†¦ italic_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âŸ© âˆˆ italic_Ï„ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_q ), vjâ€²subscriptsuperscriptğ‘£â€²ğ‘—v^{\prime}_{j}italic_v start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is an instance of ujsubscriptğ‘¢ğ‘—u_{j}italic_u start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.

    • â€“

      For each jâˆˆ[1,m]âˆ–Dâ¢oâ¢mâ¢(Ï„+â¢(q))ğ‘—1ğ‘šğ·ğ‘œğ‘šsuperscriptğœğ‘j\in[1,m]\setminus Dom(\tau^{+}(q))italic_j âˆˆ [ 1 , italic_m ] âˆ– italic_D italic_o italic_m ( italic_Ï„ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_q ) ) we have:

      vjâ€²â¢Ïƒâ¢Î·â¢Î³â¢Î¸=(vjâ€²â¢Ïƒ)â¢Î·â¢Î³â¢Î¸=vjâ€²â¢Î·â¢Î³â¢Î¸subscriptsuperscriptğ‘£â€²ğ‘—ğœğœ‚ğ›¾ğœƒsubscriptsuperscriptğ‘£â€²ğ‘—ğœğœ‚ğ›¾ğœƒsubscriptsuperscriptğ‘£â€²ğ‘—ğœ‚ğ›¾ğœƒv^{\prime}_{j}\sigma\eta\gamma\theta=(v^{\prime}_{j}\sigma)\eta\gamma\theta=v^{\prime}_{j}\eta\gamma\thetaitalic_v start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ïƒ italic_Î· italic_Î³ italic_Î¸ = ( italic_v start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ïƒ ) italic_Î· italic_Î³ italic_Î¸ = italic_v start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î· italic_Î³ italic_Î¸

      because Dâ¢oâ¢mâ¢(Ïƒ)=Vâ¢aâ¢râ¢({siâ€²|iâˆˆDâ¢oâ¢mâ¢(Ï„+â¢(p))})âŠ†Vâ¢aâ¢râ¢(c1â€²)ğ·ğ‘œğ‘šğœğ‘‰ğ‘ğ‘Ÿconditional-setsubscriptsuperscriptğ‘ â€²ğ‘–ğ‘–ğ·ğ‘œğ‘šsuperscriptğœğ‘ğ‘‰ğ‘ğ‘Ÿsubscriptsuperscriptğ‘â€²1Dom(\sigma)=Var\big{(}\{s^{\prime}_{i}\;|\;i\in Dom(\tau^{+}(p))\}\big{)}\subseteq Var(c^{\prime}_{1})italic_D italic_o italic_m ( italic_Ïƒ ) = italic_V italic_a italic_r ( { italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_i âˆˆ italic_D italic_o italic_m ( italic_Ï„ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_p ) ) } ) âŠ† italic_V italic_a italic_r ( italic_c start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) and Vâ¢aâ¢râ¢(c1â€²)âˆ©Vâ¢aâ¢râ¢(Qâ€²)=âˆ…ğ‘‰ğ‘ğ‘Ÿsubscriptsuperscriptğ‘â€²1ğ‘‰ğ‘ğ‘Ÿsuperscriptğ‘„â€²Var(c^{\prime}_{1})\cap Var(Q^{\prime})=\varnothingitalic_V italic_a italic_r ( italic_c start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) âˆ© italic_V italic_a italic_r ( italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) = âˆ…. Moreover,

      vjâ€²â¢Î·â¢Î³â¢Î¸=(vjâ€²â¢Î·)â¢Î³â¢Î¸=vjâ¢Î³â¢Î¸subscriptsuperscriptğ‘£â€²ğ‘—ğœ‚ğ›¾ğœƒsubscriptsuperscriptğ‘£â€²ğ‘—ğœ‚ğ›¾ğœƒsubscriptğ‘£ğ‘—ğ›¾ğœƒv^{\prime}_{j}\eta\gamma\theta=(v^{\prime}_{j}\eta)\gamma\theta=v_{j}\gamma\thetaitalic_v start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î· italic_Î³ italic_Î¸ = ( italic_v start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î· ) italic_Î³ italic_Î¸ = italic_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î³ italic_Î¸

      because ğ€â€²superscriptğ€â€²\textup{\bf A}^{\prime}A start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is Î”â¢[Ï„+]Î”delimited-[]superscriptğœ\Delta[\tau^{+}]roman_Î” [ italic_Ï„ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ]-more general than A for Î·ğœ‚\etaitalic_Î·. Finally,

      because Vâ¢aâ¢râ¢(Î³)âŠ†Vâ¢aâ¢râ¢(c1,c1â€²)ğ‘‰ğ‘ğ‘Ÿğ›¾ğ‘‰ğ‘ğ‘Ÿsubscriptğ‘1subscriptsuperscriptğ‘â€²1Var(\gamma)\subseteq Var(c_{1},c^{\prime}_{1})italic_V italic_a italic_r ( italic_Î³ ) âŠ† italic_V italic_a italic_r ( italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_c start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) and Vâ¢aâ¢râ¢(c1,c1â€²)âˆ©Vâ¢aâ¢râ¢(Q)=âˆ…ğ‘‰ğ‘ğ‘Ÿsubscriptğ‘1subscriptsuperscriptğ‘â€²1ğ‘‰ğ‘ğ‘Ÿğ‘„Var(c_{1},c^{\prime}_{1})\cap Var(Q)=\varnothingitalic_V italic_a italic_r ( italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_c start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) âˆ© italic_V italic_a italic_r ( italic_Q ) = âˆ….

    Consequently, we have proved that

But, by the Technical LemmaÂ 2, Ïƒâ¢Î·â¢Î³â¢Î¸ğœğœ‚ğ›¾ğœƒ\sigma\eta\gamma\thetaitalic_Ïƒ italic_Î· italic_Î³ italic_Î¸ is a unifier of pâ¢(s1â€²,â€¦,snâ€²)ğ‘subscriptsuperscriptğ‘ â€²1â€¦subscriptsuperscriptğ‘ â€²ğ‘›p(s^{\prime}_{1},\dots,s^{\prime}_{n})italic_p ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , â€¦ , italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) and pâ¢(t1â€²,â€¦,tnâ€²)ğ‘subscriptsuperscriptğ‘¡â€²1â€¦subscriptsuperscriptğ‘¡â€²ğ‘›p(t^{\prime}_{1},\dots,t^{\prime}_{n})italic_p ( italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , â€¦ , italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ). As Î¸â€²superscriptğœƒâ€²\theta^{\prime}italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is an mgu of pâ¢(s1â€²,â€¦,snâ€²)ğ‘subscriptsuperscriptğ‘ â€²1â€¦subscriptsuperscriptğ‘ â€²ğ‘›p(s^{\prime}_{1},\dots,s^{\prime}_{n})italic_p ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , â€¦ , italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) and pâ¢(t1â€²,â€¦,tnâ€²)ğ‘subscriptsuperscriptğ‘¡â€²1â€¦subscriptsuperscriptğ‘¡â€²ğ‘›p(t^{\prime}_{1},\dots,t^{\prime}_{n})italic_p ( italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , â€¦ , italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) (because Qâ€²â¢âŸ¹cÎ¸â€²Q1â€²superscriptğ‘„â€²subscriptsuperscriptâŸ¹superscriptğœƒâ€²ğ‘subscriptsuperscriptğ‘„â€²1Q^{\prime}\mathop{\Longrightarrow}\limits^{\theta^{\prime}}_{c}Q^{\prime}_{1}italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŸ¹ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT with c1â€²subscriptsuperscriptğ‘â€²1c^{\prime}_{1}italic_c start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT as input clause), there exists Î´ğ›¿\deltaitalic_Î´ such that Ïƒâ¢Î·â¢Î³â¢Î¸=Î¸â€²â¢Î´ğœğœ‚ğ›¾ğœƒsuperscriptğœƒâ€²ğ›¿\sigma\eta\gamma\theta=\theta^{\prime}\deltaitalic_Ïƒ italic_Î· italic_Î³ italic_Î¸ = italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î´. Therefore, we conclude fromÂ (8) that (ğ€â€²,ğâ€²,ğ‚â€²)superscriptğ€â€²superscriptğâ€²superscriptğ‚â€²(\textup{\bf A}^{\prime},\textup{\bf B}^{\prime},\textup{\bf C}^{\prime})( A start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , B start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , C start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) is Î”â¢[Ï„+]Î”delimited-[]superscriptğœ\Delta[\tau^{+}]roman_Î” [ italic_Ï„ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ]-more general than Q1subscriptğ‘„1Q_{1}italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT for Î¸â€²â¢Î´superscriptğœƒâ€²ğ›¿\theta^{\prime}\deltaitalic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î´. But this result implies that (ğ€â€²,ğâ€²,ğ‚â€²)â¢Î¸â€²superscriptğ€â€²superscriptğâ€²superscriptğ‚â€²superscriptğœƒâ€²(\textup{\bf A}^{\prime},\textup{\bf B}^{\prime},\textup{\bf C}^{\prime})\theta^{\prime}( A start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , B start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , C start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is Î”â¢[Ï„+]Î”delimited-[]superscriptğœ\Delta[\tau^{+}]roman_Î” [ italic_Ï„ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ]-more general than Q1subscriptğ‘„1Q_{1}italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT for Î´ğ›¿\deltaitalic_Î´ i.e. that Q1â€²subscriptsuperscriptğ‘„â€²1Q^{\prime}_{1}italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is Î”â¢[Ï„+]Î”delimited-[]superscriptğœ\Delta[\tau^{+}]roman_Î” [ italic_Ï„ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ]-more general than Q1subscriptğ‘„1Q_{1}italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT for Î´ğ›¿\deltaitalic_Î´. Finally, we have proved that Q1â€²subscriptsuperscriptğ‘„â€²1Q^{\prime}_{1}italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is Î”â¢[Ï„+]Î”delimited-[]superscriptğœ\Delta[\tau^{+}]roman_Î” [ italic_Ï„ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ]-more general than Q1subscriptğ‘„1Q_{1}italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.âˆ

Using the Propagation LemmaÂ 3, the preceding result can be extended as follows.

Proposition 6 (Î”normal-Î”\Deltaroman_Î”-Propagation)

If there exists an SLD-derivation step Qâ€²â¢âŸ¹cÎ¸â€²Q1â€²superscriptğ‘„normal-â€²subscriptsuperscriptnormal-âŸ¹superscriptğœƒnormal-â€²ğ‘subscriptsuperscriptğ‘„normal-â€²1Q^{\prime}\mathop{\Longrightarrow}\limits^{\theta^{\prime}}_{c}Q^{\prime}_{1}italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŸ¹ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT where pâ¢(t1â€²,â€¦,tnâ€²)ğ‘subscriptsuperscriptğ‘¡normal-â€²1normal-â€¦subscriptsuperscriptğ‘¡normal-â€²ğ‘›p(t^{\prime}_{1},\dots,t^{\prime}_{n})italic_p ( italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , â€¦ , italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) is the selected atom then Q1â€²subscriptsuperscriptğ‘„normal-â€²1Q^{\prime}_{1}italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is Î”â¢[Ï„+]normal-Î”delimited-[]superscriptğœ\Delta[\tau^{+}]roman_Î” [ italic_Ï„ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ]-more general than Q1subscriptğ‘„1Q_{1}italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.

Proof

(9)

Q1â€²â¢Â isÂ Î”â¢[Ï„+]-more general thanÂ â¢Q1â€²â€².subscriptsuperscriptğ‘„â€²1Â isÂ Î”â¢[Ï„+]-more general thanÂ subscriptsuperscriptğ‘„â€²â€²1Q^{\prime}_{1}\text{ is $\Delta[\tau^{+}]$-more general than }Q^{\prime\prime}_{1}\;.italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is roman_Î” [ italic_Ï„ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] -more general than italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . 9.4 Epilogue

TheoremÂ 4.2 is a direct consequence of the following result.

Proposition 7 (One Step Î”normal-Î”\Deltaroman_Î”-Lifting)

Let câ€²superscriptğ‘normal-â€²c^{\prime}italic_c start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT be a variant of cğ‘citalic_c variable disjoint with Qâ€²superscriptğ‘„normal-â€²Q^{\prime}italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. Then, for some Î¸â€²superscriptğœƒnormal-â€²\theta^{\prime}italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and Q1â€²subscriptsuperscriptğ‘„normal-â€²1Q^{\prime}_{1}italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT,

  • â€¢

    Qâ€²â¢âŸ¹cÎ¸â€²Q1â€²superscriptğ‘„â€²subscriptsuperscriptâŸ¹superscriptğœƒâ€²ğ‘subscriptsuperscriptğ‘„â€²1Q^{\prime}\mathop{\Longrightarrow}\limits^{\theta^{\prime}}_{c}Q^{\prime}_{1}italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŸ¹ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT where câ€²superscriptğ‘â€²c^{\prime}italic_c start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is the input clause used,

  • â€¢

    Qâ€²â¢âŸ¹cÎ¸â€²Q1â€²superscriptğ‘„â€²subscriptsuperscriptâŸ¹superscriptğœƒâ€²ğ‘subscriptsuperscriptğ‘„â€²1Q^{\prime}\mathop{\Longrightarrow}\limits^{\theta^{\prime}}_{c}Q^{\prime}_{1}italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŸ¹ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is a Î”â¢[Ï„+]Î”delimited-[]superscriptğœ\Delta[\tau^{+}]roman_Î” [ italic_Ï„ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ]-lift of Qâ¢âŸ¹cÎ¸Q1ğ‘„subscriptsuperscriptâŸ¹ğœƒğ‘subscriptğ‘„1Q\mathop{\Longrightarrow}\limits^{\theta}_{c}Q_{1}italic_Q âŸ¹ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.

Proof

Let c1â€²:=pâ¢(s1â€²,â€¦,snâ€²)â†ğâ€²assignsubscriptsuperscriptğ‘â€²1ğ‘subscriptsuperscriptğ‘ â€²1â€¦subscriptsuperscriptğ‘ â€²ğ‘›â†superscriptğâ€²c^{\prime}_{1}:=p(s^{\prime}_{1},\dots,s^{\prime}_{n})\leftarrow\textup{\bf B}^{\prime}italic_c start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT := italic_p ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , â€¦ , italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) â† B start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT be a variant of c1subscriptğ‘1c_{1}italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Then there exists a renaming Î³ğ›¾\gammaitalic_Î³ such that Vâ¢aâ¢râ¢(Î³)âŠ†Vâ¢aâ¢râ¢(c1,c1â€²)ğ‘‰ğ‘ğ‘Ÿğ›¾ğ‘‰ğ‘ğ‘Ÿsubscriptğ‘1subscriptsuperscriptğ‘â€²1Var(\gamma)\subseteq Var(c_{1},c^{\prime}_{1})italic_V italic_a italic_r ( italic_Î³ ) âŠ† italic_V italic_a italic_r ( italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_c start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) and c1=c1â€²â¢Î³subscriptğ‘1subscriptsuperscriptğ‘â€²1ğ›¾c_{1}=c^{\prime}_{1}\gammaitalic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_c start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î³. Suppose also that

Notice that the following claim holds.

Claim

Suppose that the atoms Ağ´Aitalic_A and Hğ»Hitalic_H are variable disjoint and unify. Then, Ağ´Aitalic_A also unifies with any variant Hâ€²superscriptğ»â€²H^{\prime}italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT of Hğ»Hitalic_H variable disjoint with Ağ´Aitalic_A.
